description:
We'll take a first look at what docker is and how it can help us during our day-to-day job.

A special thanks to Combell for providing us venue for this first meetup.
name: #1 Kick-off: What is Docker?

description: We'll have a look at how you can leverage Docker to deploy new versions of your apps easily.
name: #2 Deploying apps with Docker

description: In a world where micro-services are changing the way companies, both big and small, run their applications, we need to transform the way we look at infrastructure, and treat our pool of servers as 1 big computer. Mesos is THE tool to achieve this and together with Docker, they form the ideal Dream Team.
name: #3 Docker on Mesos

description:
This one came falling straight out of the Sky: Ben Hindman, creator of Mesos, is visiting Brussels and will drop by to talk about how Mesos can help us scale like twitter. Awesome!

Benjamin Hindman - How to Scale Like Twitter Using Containers and Apache Mesos

Operating at web scale requires two key technologies: containerization and cluster scheduling. Now companies of all sizes can scale like Google and Twitter with open source tools like Apache Mesos that lets you run containers at large scale across an entire datacenter or cloud. Apache Mesos is in production use at companies like Twitter, Netflix and Airbnb where it is used to deliver web-scale, fault-tolerant, easy to deploy applications and services. In today's world where applications and data no longer fit on single machines, Mesos is the distributed systems kernel that stitches together all of the datacenter resources (machines or VM instances) into a single pool of resources from which all applications can draw. It is highly-available, fault-tolerant and increases resource utilization dramatically. Mesos provides the primitives and abstractions the lets programmers and operators build and maintain highly complex distributed systems at scale.

Benjamin Hindman is the co-creator of Apache Mesos, a commercial-grade distributed systems platform that turns your entire datacenter or cloud into what looks like one big computer. Ben co-developed Mesos as a PhD student at UC Berkeley’s AMPlab before bringing it to Twitter where it now runs on thousands of machines. An academic at heart, his research in programming languages and distributed systems has been published in leading academic conferences.

Update:

Pizza is kindly sponsored by Kangaroot. Thx guys!
name: How to scale like Twitter - by Ben Hindman, creator of Mesos!

description:
Join other members of the Docker community to hack on Docker projects using the next major Docker release! You can hack using Docker from anywhere and present your hack to the Docker team and community via video!


The official back channel for this event on IRC is #docker. Throughout the day, the Docker team and the Docker community will be on IRC helping you hack your project or answering questions about Docker. 

The prize for the winners of the local edition will a limited edition Docker Merit badge !


The prize for the global winners will be full conference passes to DockerCon Europe + travel expenses ! 

The official hashtag for the event on Twitter is #dockerhackday.

More details are on the Docker blog . 

If you can't attend in person you can also participate remotely. 

Feel free to ask if you have any questions. 

The exact location of this meetup will be announced shortly as we're looking for a room comfortable enough for a hacking session.

Please attend only if you want to participate in the Global Hack Day.

SPONSORS:

About Digital Ocean

DigitalOcean is simplifying the cloud by providing an infrastructure experience that developers love. Launch an SSD cloud server in 55 seconds and scale your infrastructure with our simple API. Over 200,000 developers deploy their code to DigitalOcean and thousands more are joining every week. Read more

About Rackspace 

Rackspace® (NYSE: RAX) is the global leader in hybrid cloud and founder of OpenStack®, the open-source operating system for the cloud. Hundreds of thousands of customers look to Rackspace to deliver the best-fit infrastructure for their IT needs, leveraging a product portfolio that allows workloads to run where they perform best— whether on the public cloud, private cloud, dedicated servers, or a combination of platforms. Rackspace is featured on Fortune’s list of 100 Best Companies to Work For. Read more



About Online Labs 

Online Labs is the first hosting provider worldwide to offer dedicated arm servers in the cloud. It’s the ideal platform for horizontal scaling and containerized apps.

The solution natively supports docker and provides on demand resources: it comes with on-demand SSD storage, movable IPs and an S3 compatible object storage service. Read more
name: Docker Global Hackday #2

description:
Marcus Hughes from ClusterHQ will talk about "Running databases inside docker containers" using Flocker to handle and migrate persistent data. 


This meetup is kindly sponsored by Kangaroot and will be hosted at their offices!
name: #4 Persistent storage in Docker
